author: Albert Einstein
description: Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist widely recognized for developing the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics.
text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Maya Angelou
description: Maya Angelou was an American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist. Her work discusses themes such as identity, racism, and family.
text: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.

author: Nelson Mandela
description: Nelson Mandela was a South African anti-apartheid revolutionary, political leader, and philanthropist who served as President of South Africa from 1994 to 1999.
text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: Walt Disney
description: Walt Disney was an American entrepreneur, animator, and film producer. He co-founded The Walt Disney Company and created iconic characters such as Mickey Mouse.
text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

author: Steve Jobs
description: Steve Jobs was an American business magnate, industrial designer, and co-founder of Apple Inc. He played a pivotal role in the development of personal computers.
text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
description: Eleanor Roosevelt was an American political figure, diplomat, and activist. She served as First Lady of the United States from 1933 to 1945.
text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: John Lennon
description: John Lennon was an English singer, songwriter, and peace activist who co-founded the Beatles, one of the most successful bands in history.
text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.

author: Aristotle
description: Aristotle was a Greek philosopher and polymath during the Classical period in Ancient Greece. He made significant contributions to various fields, including ethics and metaphysics.
text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
description: Mahatma Gandhi was an Indian lawyer, anti-colonial nationalist, and political ethicist who employed nonviolent resistance to lead India to independence from British rule.
text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.

author: Confucius
description: Confucius was a Chinese philosopher and teacher whose ideas have deeply influenced East Asian philosophy and culture. He emphasized personal and governmental morality, justice, and sincerity.
text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
